meanings.definition: to perform a dressage movement in which a horse trots in place
meanings.sent1: The elegant horse piaffers gracefully during the dressage competition.
meanings.sent2: The trainer taught the horse to piaffers with precision and control.
meanings.sent3: The horse decided to piaffers in the middle of the field, much to the surprise of the spectators.
meanings.sent4: As the music played, the horse seemed to piaffers in perfect harmony with the rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The horse's ability to piaffers captivated the audience with its beauty and skill.

meanings.definition: individuals who excel at the dressage movement of piaffe
meanings.sent1: The piaffers at the competition showcased their talent and dedication to the sport.
meanings.sent2: She admired the graceful movements of the piaffers as they performed in the arena.
meanings.sent3: The group of piaffers shared a laugh backstage before their performance.
meanings.sent4: Among all the riders, she stood out as the piaffers with the most finesse.
meanings.sent5: The piaffers received a standing ovation for their outstanding performance.
